gmd:metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19139 Geographic Information - Metadata - Implementation Specification

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Inventory of Dams, Derived from EPA BASINS: Indiana, 2003

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: (Compiler and Editor: Bernardin, Lochmueller and Associates)

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: DAMS_1996_EPA_IN is a point shapefile developed by the USEPA BASINS 3.0 program and clipped by Bernardin, Lochmueller and Associates. Clips were performed using the state field and selecting Indiana therefore some points located within the state but attributed to another were removed and some points located outside the state boundary but attributed to be inside are included. US Environmental Protection Agency BASINS metadata reports - This dataset provides a locational map of 75,187 dams in the conterminous United States. The National Inventory of Dams was originally developed by the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers and the Federal Emergency Management Agency. It was developed to track dam related problem areas. This database shows the age of the dam, number of people living downstream, and some inspection information. The dam inspection data also includes location information (such as latitude, longitude and nearest town), a description of a dam's size, reservoir capacity, the owner and the regulatory oversight agency. For distribution with BASINS v.2.0, the data layer was prepared in Arcview shape file format.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: US Environmental Protection Agency BASINS metadata reports - "The National Inventory of Dams was originally developed by the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers and the Federal Emergency Management Agency. It was developed to track dam related problem areas. This database shows the age of the dam, number of people living downstream, and some inspection information. The dam inspection data also includes location information (such as latitude, longitude and nearest town), a description of a dam's size, reservoir capacity, the owner and the regulatory oversight agency."

gmd:credit.gco:CharacterString: Indiana Statewide GIS database was produced under an Indiana Department of Transportation contract. Data is from the USEPA, BASINS 3.0.

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: DATA DISCLAIMER This is a small scale national database and positional error does exist. Use should be limited to broad planning and information, however, completeness and horizontal position issues prohibit this digital file from replacing field review for final decision making. This data set was compiled by Bernardin, Lochmueller and Associates, using data believed to be accurate; however, a degree of error is inherent in all data. This product is distributed "AS-IS" without warranties of any kind, either expressed or implied, including but not limited to warranties of suitability of a particular purpose or use. No attempt has been made in either the designed format or production of these data to define the limits or jurisdiction of any federal, state, or local government. These data are intended for use only at the published scale or smaller and are for reference purposes only. They are not to be construed as a legal document or survey instrument. A detailed on-the-ground survey and historical analysis of a single site may differ from this data. US Environmental Protection Agency BASINS metadata reports - "Intended use of data- This data set was prepared to support the U.S. EPA BASINS (Better Assessment Science Integrating Point and Nonpoint Sources) System. The dam point coverage provides Geographic Information System GIS) applications with a valuable data layer for base mapping of dam locations. These locations are used in numerous types of analysis, e.g., stream network analysis, hydrologic flow." CREDIT Please acknowledge USEPA. The data was developed by the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency as part of BASINS 3.0

No claims to accuracy are made on this data. It is intended to be used only for general planning purposes. Detailed planning or analysis will require more accurate data. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY The product is provided "AS IS", without any other warranties or conditions, expressed or implied, including, but not limited to, warranties for product quality, or suitability to a particular purpose or use. The risk or liability resulting from the use of this product is assumed by the user. Bernardin, Lochmueller and Associates shares no liability with product users indirect, incidental, special, or consequential damages whatsoever, including, but not limited to, loss of revenue or profit, lost or damaged data or other commercial or economic loss. Bernardin, Lochmueller and Associates is not responsible for claims by a third party. The maximum aggregate liability to the original purchaser shall not exceed the amount paid by you for the product.

gmd:supplementalInformation.gco:CharacterString: Data was obtained from the USEPA BASINS 3.0 Region 5 CD, <http://www.epa.gov/OST/BASINS/>, and was developed by the USEPA, Office of Water, OST from the National Inventory of Dams created by the US Army Corps of Engineers and the Federal Emergency Management Agency. For further documentation and information on the National Inventory of Dams <http://www.nicar.org/data/dams/>

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: No information was included in the original BASINS 3.0 metadata. Some points overlap but each appears to have a unique identification although no formal tests were performed.
No information was included in the original BASINS 3.0 metadata.
No information was included in original BASINS 3.0 metadata. No errors have yet been found in use, considering 1996 data.

Observing positional accuracy suggests that this layer is best used at smaller scales (suggest >1:45,000). Larger scales may present the problem of the point not being located directly on the stream/pond where it is actually located. Some errors may be significant as is suggested by several points located outside the state boundary but attributed to be within the state.
No information was included in the original BASINS 3.0 metadata. Vertical accuracy does not appear to be a factor in the digital production of the data set.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: US Environmental Protection Agency BASINS metadata reports - "This dataset provides a locational map of 75,187 dams in the conterminous United States. The National Inventory of Dams was originally developed by the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers and the Federal Emergency Management Agency. It was developed to track dam related problem areas. This database shows the age of the dam, number of people living downstream, and some inspection information. The dam inspection data also includes location information (such as latitude, longitude and nearest town), a description of a dam's size, reservoir capacity, the owner and the regulatory oversight agency. For distribution with BASINS v.2.0, the data layer was prepared in Arcview shape file format."

A file named dam was obtained by Bernardin, Lochmueller & Associates from the USEPA BASINS 3.0 Region 5 CD, <http://www.epa.gov/OST/BASINS/>. The file was selected down to records displaying "Indiana" in the county field and transformed from Geographic to UTM, Zone 16, NAD 83, meters. The following fields were deleted from original because of no data - Num_locks lock_len, and Lock_width

This metadata was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit. v 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (United States Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: National Inventory of Dams 1996 in BASINS version 3.0

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the BLA/IGS. It should not to be altered or summarized. BLA/IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the BLA/IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.

gmd:maintenanceNote.gco:CharacterString: Metadata was created as or translated to ISO 19139 for inclusion in the Big Ten Academic Alliance Geoportal.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Big Ten Academic Alliance Geospatial Data Project
